snippet: Syria’s Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday that more than a dozen Western envoys were no longer welcome, a response to the coordinated expulsions last week of 11 Syrian diplomats.
abstract: Syria's Foreign Ministry announces that 17 Western ambassadors and envoys will no longer be welcome in the country, a response to the coordinated expulsion of Syrian diplomats from the United States and 10 other nations; tough stance is tempered by Syria's agreement to allow international relief agencies to increase their presence and deliver aid to an estimated one million people.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: J. David Goodman reported from New York, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Syria’s Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday that more than a dozen Western envoys were no longer welcome, a response to the coordinated expulsions last week of 11 Syrian diplomats.

headline.main: Syria Bars 17 Western Diplomats and Allows Increased Aid Agency Presence
headline.print_headline: Syria Bars 17 Western Diplomats and Allows Increased Aid Agency Presence

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
